thread.title: Inmate walks away from Mill Creek Correctional Facility in Salem
thread.title_full: Inmate walks away from Mill Creek Correctional Facility in Salem | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Inmate walks away from Mill Creek Correctional Facility in Salem
text:
Authorities are looking for a man who walked away from Mill Creek Correctional Facility in Salem on Thursday.
Hilario Lopez, 25, was convicted of robbery in 2011. He walked away from Mill Creek Correctional Facility in Salem on Oct. 22, 2015. Oregon Department of Corrections Hilario Lopez, 25, went missing at about 6:45 p.m. on Thursday. He was last seen inside the minimum security prison wearing blue jeans with the word "inmate" and the DOC logo stenciled on the knee in orange and a blue T-shirt with the word "inmate" and the DOC logo stenciled in orange on the front and back, according to a news release from the Oregon Department of Corrections.
Lopez was sentenced to prison after being convicted of two counts of robbery in the second degree and one count of felon in possession of a weapon out of Marion County. He entered DOC custody in February 2011. His earliest release date could have been March 7, 2018.
The prison is an unfenced facility that houses about 290 inmates who are within four years of release. Oregon State Police is investigating how Lopez managed to escape.
Anyone with information about Lopez's whereabouts is asked to call 1-800-452-7888.
This post will be updated as more information becomes available.
